official-title.#text:
To promote transparent, collaborative, and cost-effective national ambient air quality standards
			 for ozone under the Clean Air Act and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Clear the Air with Congress Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Clear the Air with Congress Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: National ambient air quality standards for ozone

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Administrator of the Environmental
			 Protection Agency

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and make publically available a
			 report that contains each of the following:

text.#text:
Not less than 180 days before issuance of any rule proposing a new or revised national primary or
			 secondary ambient air quality standard for ozone under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 109 of the
			 Clean Air Act

header.#text: Report to Congress prior To proposing new standard

text.#text: The standard (in parts per million) to be proposed.

All scientific and technical data relied upon to support the proposed standard in a manner that is
			 sufficient for independent analysis and substantial reproduction of
			 results.

A description of all technologies and strategies that may be utilized to achieve the standard and
			 the direct and indirect costs of such technologies and strategies.
An economic impact analysis that estimates the total costs of the standard, including—
the impact to gross domestic product and employment by State;
the cost of wholesale and retail electricity by State; and

A list of each area of the United States, including each county, that would be in nonattainment
			 under the standard.

An identification of the level of ground level ozone in each county of the United States that is
			 naturally occurring or produced outside of the United States.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall take into consideration the cost
			 and economic and technological feasibility of attaining such standard.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Administrator of
			 the Environmental Protection Agency

text.#text: In establishing a national primary or secondary ambient air quality standard for ozone under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 109 of the Clean Air Act

header.#text: Consideration of economic and technological feasibility

text.#text: A national primary or secondary ambient air quality standard for ozone under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall not take effect unless a Federal
			 statute is enacted approving such standard.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 109 of the
			 Clean Air Act

header.#text: Approval by law of national ambient air quality standards for ozone
